verses.verse: A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of Asaph. <S%H623><s%> Truly <S%H389><s%> God <S%H430><s%> is good <S%H2896><s%> to Israel, <S%H3478><s%> even to such as are of a clean <S%H1249><s%> heart. <S%H3824><s%>
But as for me, my feet <S%H7272><s%> were almost <S%H4592><s%> gone; <S%H5186><s%> my steps <S%H838><s%> had well <S%H369><s%> near <S%H4592><s%> slipped. <S%H8210><s%>
For I was envious <S%H7065><s%> at the foolish, <S%H1984><s%> when I saw <S%H7200><s%> the prosperity <S%H7965><s%> of the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>
For there are no <S%H369><s%> bands <S%H2784><s%> in their death: <S%H4194><s%> but their strength <S%H193><s%> is firm. <S%H1277><s%>
They are not in trouble <S%H5999><s%> as other men; <S%H582><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> are they plagued <S%H5060><s%> like <S%H5973><s%> other men. <S%H120><s%>
Therefore pride <S%H1346><s%> compasses <S%H6059><s%> them about as a chain; <S%H6059><s%> violence <S%H2555><s%> covers <S%H5848><s%> them as a garment. <S%H7897><s%>
Their eyes <S%H5869><s%> stand <S%H3318><s%> out with fatness: <S%H2459><s%> they have more <S%H5674><s%> than heart <S%H3824><s%> could wish. <S%H4906><s%>
They are corrupt, <S%H4167><s%> and speak <S%H1696><s%> wickedly <S%H7451><s%> concerning oppression: <S%H6233><s%> they speak <S%H1696><s%> loftily. <S%H4791><s%>
They set <S%H8371><s%> their mouth <S%H6310><s%> against the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> and their tongue <S%H3956><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> through the earth. <S%H776><s%>
Therefore <S%H3651><s%> his people <S%H5971><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> here: <S%H1988><s%> and waters <S%H4325><s%> of a full <S%H4392><s%> cup are wrung <S%H4680><s%> out to them.
And they say, <S%H559><s%> How <S%H349><s%> does God <S%H410><s%> know? <S%H3045><s%> and is there knowledge <S%H1844><s%> in the most <S%H5945><s%> High? <S%H5945><s%>
Behold, <S%H2009><s%> these <S%H428><s%> are the ungodly, <S%H7563><s%> who prosper <S%H7951><s%> in the world; <S%H5769><s%> they increase <S%H7685><s%> in riches. <S%H2428><s%>
Truly <S%H389><s%> I have cleansed <S%H2135><s%> my heart <S%H3824><s%> in vain, <S%H7385><s%> and washed <S%H7364><s%> my hands <S%H3709><s%> in innocence. <S%H5356><s%>
For all <S%H3605><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> long have I been <S%H1961><s%> plagued, <S%H5060><s%> and chastened <S%H8433><s%> every morning. <S%H1242><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I say, <S%H559><s%> I will speak <S%H5608><s%> thus; <S%H3644><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> I should offend <S%H898><s%> against the generation <S%H1755><s%> of your children. <S%H1121><s%>
When I thought <S%H2803><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> this, <S%H2063><s%> it was too painful <S%H5999><s%> for me;
Until <S%H5704><s%> I went <S%H935><s%> into <S%H413><s%> the sanctuary <S%H4720><s%> of God; <S%H410><s%> then understood <S%H995><s%> I their end. <S%H319><s%>
Surely <S%H389><s%> you did set <S%H7896><s%> them in slippery <S%H2513><s%> places: you cast <S%H5307><s%> them down <S%H5307><s%> into destruction. <S%H4876><s%>
How <S%H349><s%> are they brought into desolation, <S%H8047><s%> as in a moment! <S%H7281><s%> they are utterly consumed <S%H8552><s%> with terrors. <S%H1091><s%>
As a dream <S%H2472><s%> when one wakes; <S%H6974><s%> so, O Lord, <S%H136><s%> when you wake, <S%H5782><s%> you shall despise <S%H959><s%> their image. <S%H6754><s%>
Thus <S%H3588><s%> my heart <S%H3824><s%> was grieved, <S%H2556><s%> and I was pricked <S%H8150><s%> in my reins. <S%H3629><s%>
So foolish <S%H1198><s%> was I, and ignorant: <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3045><s%> I was as a beast <S%H929><s%> before <S%H5973><s%> you.
Nevertheless I am continually <S%H8548><s%> with you: you have held <S%H270><s%> me by my right <S%H3225><s%> hand. <S%H3027><s%>
You shall guide <S%H5148><s%> me with your counsel, <S%H6098><s%> and afterward <S%H310><s%> receive <S%H3947><s%> me to glory. <S%H3519><s%>
Whom <S%H4310><s%> have I in heaven <S%H8064><s%> but you? and there is none <S%H3808><s%> on earth <S%H776><s%> that I desire <S%H2654><s%> beside <S%H5973><s%> you.

My flesh <S%H7607><s%> and my heart <S%H3824><s%> fails: <S%H3615><s%> but God <S%H430><s%> is the strength <S%H6697><s%> of my heart, <S%H3824><s%> and my portion <S%H2506><s%> for ever. <S%H5769><s%>

For, see, <S%H2005><s%> they that are far <S%H7369><s%> from you shall perish: <S%H6><s%> you have destroyed <S%H6789><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> them that go <S%H935><s%> a whoring <S%H2181><s%> from you.

But it is good <S%H2896><s%> for me to draw near <S%H7132><s%> to God: <S%H430><s%> I have put <S%H7896><s%> my trust <S%H4268><s%> in the Lord <S%H136><s%> GOD, <S%H3069><s%> that I may declare <S%H5608><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> your works. <S%H4399><s%>
